right side you have too little stitches your gauge is too ws - wrong side large and you should try a smaller hook chain - chain everyone s gauge is different but this is the st - stitch gauge i achieved with a size 5mm hook and slip_stitch - slip_stitch aran weight acrylic please follow suit if you single_crochet - single_crochet would like to achieve a similar product double_crochet - double_crochet blsc - single_crochet in back loop fpdc - front post double_crochet double_crochet around stitch from last round from front pattern notes skill level beginner-intermediate i used hobby lobby s i love this yarn for this sample but i have also made samples with other aran/worsted weight acrylic and acrylic blends and they all made for lovely pumpkin beanies as long as you meet gauge and are happy with the fabric please feel free to make substitutions as you wish 🙂 the pumpkin beanie is crocheted in the round top-down then the ribbing is worked flat back and forth around the edge and sewn together the stem is built-in and the leaves and vine are worked separate and sewn on sizes 1-3yo child adult dimensions with brim folded circumference 17 in 22in length 7 5 in 9in all yardage is given a cushion and has been increased by about 10% to ensure everyone has enough yarn regardless of gauge e g i only used about 100yds of the orange but the yardage i list is 110yds gauge dimensions 13dcs = 4 inches chains at beginning of rounds do not count as stitches unless otherwise stated number in parentheses at the end of a round is the stitch count this is one of my first patterns i have tested extensively but if you have any questions or concerns please feel free to reach out to me and i ll do my best to help you out 😁 stem instructions child 1-3yrs size only using 5mm hook and brown make a magic_ring or ch4 and slip_stitch to 1st chain to form a circle round 1 rs ch1 12sc into the circle slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet to close 12sc rounds 2-5 rs ch1 and 1sc in same st 1sc in each st around slip_stitch to 1st single_crochet 12sc round 6 rs ch1 2sc into same st 2sc in each st around slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet 24sc round 7 rs ch3 and 2dc in same st 2dc in each st around slip_stitch to 1st double_crochet to close 48dc round 8 rs ch3
